item.title: My Fourth Web Page
item.description:
This is the Fourth Web Page.

Having now spent a few more minutes with this Pelican, I find that one of the frequently asked questions is whether the Pelican is only good for a blog (last entry) or if it can be used for presenting a collection of documents. I am still having difficulty with persuading the links and static documents to appear in the right place.
item.dc:creator: Chris Duncombe Rae

item.title: Third Web Page
item.description:
This is the Third Web Page.

Having now spent a few minutes with this Pelican, I think it is a good idea for publishing some blog, but not right for presenting a collection of documents.

  1. Pages are turned into entries depending on the date tag in them.
  2. Documents can be referred to from the blog entries.
  3. Only the blog entries are converted from Markdown to HTML. (I think Derrick is looking for something that will auto convert Markdown docs to HTML docs. Pelican look like it will convert Markdown docs to blog entries.)

While here, let's see what a long entry looks like, using some lorem ipsum output ...

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Morbi id dolor sodales, aliquam purus eu, elementum augue. Aliquam consectetur porta nibh, sed hendrerit sem aliquet nec. Proin pharetra, sapien quis tempus gravida, lectus metus interdum nulla, vitae luctus risus augue ac velit. Nam at nibh hendrerit enim convallis lacinia. Ut tincidunt enim ac lorem ornare rutrum. Vivamus tempus turpis ut magna cursus vestibulum. Vivamus non porttitor eros, eget ullamcorper sem. Suspendisse porta porta lectus. Donec vehicula bibendum neque, at pellentesque arcu vulputate sed.

item.dc:creator: Chris Duncombe Rae

item.title: CTD Calibration Document
item.description:
CTD Calibration Document

A new document discusses CTD data calibration and the tedious mechanisms required to reprocess and generate new data files before loading them up to the data center for publication. This excellent review and presentation of new material by the author is set to become an extremely valuable tool in the preparation and analysis of recalcitrant Conductivity-Temperature-Depth date.

The document is to be found over here.
item.dc:creator: Chris Duncombe Rae

item.title: My Second Web Page
item.description: In this page we look at some content. in the next post we are going to talk about CTD data calibration and we will put a summary here and link to the document.
item.dc:creator: Chris Duncombe Rae

item.title: My First Web Page
item.description:
The following is a first look at the wonderful new IOOS Webpages.

These web pages were written in markdown, converted to html by Pelican, and published on github (eventually). Right now of course I am looking at them locally using Python simpleHTTPServer. Woo-woo!
item.dc:creator: Chris Duncombe Rae
